body.p: Therefore, the Board decided that in applying paragraph 10(a) in the limited circumstances in which a parent establishes a new parent in this particular manner, the new parent should measure the cost of its investment in the original parent at the carrying amount of its share of the equity items shown in the separate financial statements of the original parent at the date of the reorganisation. In December 2007 the Board published an exposure draft proposing to amend IAS 27 to add a paragraph with that requirement.
